Yes, you should have informed your members that you were collecting this information. Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), which applies in France, you are required to inform individuals about the collection and processing of their personal data. This includes explaining what data is being collected, why it is being collected, how it will be used, and any other relevant information.

Here is a summary of the information you should have provided:

1. The identity and contact details of the association (the data controller).
2. The purposes of the processing (in this case, to plan activities).
3. The legal basis for the processing (likely legitimate interest or consent).
4. Any recipients of the data (if applicable).
5. The rights of the data subjects (e.g., right to access, rectify, or delete their data).

For future data collections, make sure to provide this information to your members to ensure compliance with GDPR.

If you have any further questions or need assistance with data protection practices, feel free to ask!

- General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
